definition: to take revenge and erase humiliation (idiom)
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)
spouse/companion
surname Qiu
surname Xue
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
shame/disgrace

sentences.english: To execute vengeance upon the nations, chastisements among the people.
sentences.chinese: 为向异邦报仇雪耻，为向列国进攻袭击。

sentences.english: It's a battle for fame, and especially for Milan it's the very chance to avenge a wrong and wipe out a humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 特别是对于我的米兰，这是再好不过的报仇雪耻之际。

definition: to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to take revenge for a past insult/to expunge a disgrace or humiliation
to erase/to wipe out (a previous humiliation etc)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. to lie on firewood and taste gall (idiom); fig. suffering patiently, but firmly resolved on revenge
to send troops
to recover (territory or power)/the liberation of Taiwan from Japanese rule in 1945
Guangfu or Kuangfu township in Hualien County 花蓮縣|花莲县[Hua1 lian2 Xian4], east Taiwan
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
Tartar (derogatory)/also used as an insulting term for Manchus around 1900
to achieve or accomplish goals
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
render service to repay kindness
to give one's body for the nation (idiom); to spend one's whole life in the service of the country
to dispatch an army/to send troops
